website_summaries.verdict: These tried and trusted cat nail caps have earned a well-deserved reputation for being safe, reasonably easy for humans to get on, and difficult for cats to get off.
pros: Soft, comfortable, and safe for cats
Easy to apply once you get the hang of it
Each application lasts between 4 to 6 weeks
Even determined kitties have a difficult time getting them off
Thick enough to keep claws from poking through
Available in a variety of colors and sizes
cons: They seem to run a bit small and some owners had more success getting larger sizes to stay put

customer_reviews.title: Soft Claws saved my cat's hyde
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because one of my cats reaches around and grabs her side when she cleans herself, and she was beginning to put some pretty big holes in her skin. Having no desire to put her through the horrendous experience of de-clawing, I sought out other options. My cat actually tolerated the process of putting them on quite a bit better than I expected - no kitty burrito required. She doesn't love them, but she tolerates them. She still grabs her side when cleaning, but I haven't found any scratches or giant sores since I put these on her. Over all I would say this was a great investment. Soft Claws saved me a trip to the vet.
customer_reviews.author: S. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: So thankful for these caps
customer_reviews.text: Never needed to try these until our 17 year old cat developed a tumor inside of his ear. With regular vet care and daily at home care, he's been doing well except for the times he would start scratching his ear and breaking skin. We bought these caps and applied them to his hind nails and they've been wonderful. Now our cat can still scratch without hurting himself and we don't have to consider keeping a cone on his head. The first one came off yesterday and I trimmed the nail and installed a new one. Other than that, none of the others have fallen off in the 2.5 weeks they've been on.
customer_reviews.author: marw

customer_reviews.title: I loved these. My cat was a terror
customer_reviews.text: I loved these. My cat was a terror, running through the house, climbing on the curtains, and scratching the walls, doors, and furniture. She wore these for a year. The first couple of times was kind of hard to get them on her, but we gave her treats and from then on out it wasn't hard. We got her nails clipped, then put the glue in all of the covers at once, and quickly put them on her. Then we fed her while they dried so she wouldn't mess with them.
customer_reviews.author: Mollie H

customer_reviews.title: Save your FURNITURE!
customer_reviews.text: These nail caps have saved my new couches because one of my two cats likes to get my negative attention! Pros: -Lasts 2-4 weeks each -Looks cute, gets a lot of compliments -Cat doesn't seem to mind them (once they're on) -Glue bottle rarely dries out and can be used for all the nails -Glue dries quickly Cons: -Depending on your cat this may take 2 people -It's easy to get glue on yourself as it's hard to fill the nails -Need to make sure they're the right size or they won't stay on long -Nails tend to run out before glue does
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Bratton

customer_reviews.title: These have improved!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time buying Soft Claws... the first time, I got blue glitter, and I was disappointed because they did not stay on my kitty's claws for very long-- maybe a couple of days, max. It seemed like I was replacing one or two pretty much daily. However, I thought I would give them another try, so I bought them in red for the holidays. These really seem to be staying on!! I have to replace them every two or three weeks, now, and only a couple at a time. They don't really work for the dew claws, but overall, I recommend them if your cat is fairly cooperative.
customer_reviews.author: Jeninja

customer_reviews.title: No More Scratching
customer_reviews.text: Great product that can save your furniture without subjecting your cat to declawing. They're very easy to apply, although my cat is pretty docile. I would say I replace 1 or 2 nails every 3-4 weeks. Follow the directions and let the glue dry before letting your cat go to inevitably try to chew them off. My cat has yet to successfully chew one off, but they do fall off eventually as the nail grows. I believe your vet and local cat groomer will apply them for you if you're unable to. I call them his Lady Gaga nails :p
customer_reviews.author: kay_lobo18

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for My Cats and Shelter Cats
customer_reviews.text: These caps fit my Maine Coon and my Siberian cat without an issue. The claw caps stayed for the time specified on the package. The colors were really vivid and complemented my cat's color well. I used these for foster cats and kittens as well for adoption promotions. Red soft paws look really nice on a black cat for instance and can draw in more adopters. Also like to throw on a red rhinestone collar. Fantastic product and at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: SiamicTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Please do not declaw your cats.
customer_reviews.text: Such an awesome alternative to declawing. Did you know that declawing a cat actually is comparable to ripping off a persons finger nails? Cats need this part of their body. Many will stop using the little box after the procedure due to the pain. I've been using these for years. My only issue with this particular pack is that the glue is sometimes dried up. I called soft claws and they said that sometimes if you buy through amazon, it could of been on the shelf for a long time. It's better to buy straight from the site or even just order extra glue from the site. She also said keeping your glue in the refrigerator should help!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: I mistakenly tried to save some money and bought the knockoff brand before I bought these. The knockoff brand was cheaper and came with a ton more nail caps but they didn't stick. The material of the cap just did not adhere well to the glue, so you'd place them on the nail, hold down for 10 seconds, and they'd just slide right off as you pulled your hand away. So frustrating! THESE on the other hand, work perfectly! No issues whatsoever with them sticking like they should. I will be purchasing more!
customer_reviews.author: britmar12

customer_reviews.title: Amazed.
customer_reviews.text: I am honestly surprised by how well these stayed on. We were moving out and all of the now free corners of the house were getting clawed by my youngest cat- we just needed something for 3 weeks to keep her from destroying the house we were renting. I figured I would have to reapply these but it has been a month and she has only lost one of them, even after chewing on them for the first few hours. Will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne

customer_reviews.title: Older cat looks fabulous while not making me lose my 250 deposit!
customer_reviews.text: Stayed on great, I applied them a couple days after my purchase (August) and as of November all of them except for two have stayed on. The adhesive works great and the caps don't wear down. With this being said, my cat is a senior (10+ yrs) so she's not that spastic about her nails and is fairly easy-going, so for a hyperactive kitten I can't guarantee. But for my kitty, we love claw caps!! No loss of deposit here. :)
customer_reviews.author: Susan H.

customer_reviews.title: Purrfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: The process of getting them on was less than enjoyable, and it took the cats a hot minute to get used to them BUT once they did I could fully appreciate the awesomeness of the nail caps. The cats can roam where they wish and we do not live in fear of them using our new furniture as their scratching post!!
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Don't De-claw your cat these are AWESOME!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best! I have been using these for a year with my cat who loves to love with her claws. They are easy to put on after trimming the cats nails first. They last about 6-8 weeks. These are much better for your fur baby then having them de-clawed. I would recommend buying extra tubes of glue as in my opinion the one it comes with is not enough for all 40 caps.
customer_reviews.author: Vikkie

customer_reviews.title: Not cruel to declaw
customer_reviews.text: My cat hated these and chewed them off within and hour, we eneded up declawing her and now she is a sweet cluddly kitty who loves people. Its not cruel if it saves them!
customer_reviews.author: kitsune

customer_reviews.title: Fiesty cat not compatible
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to have these installed on my cat but struggled to do it myself. I asked the vet about application and they said they would have to sedate the cat to apply them. Since that was outrageous and would have to be redone every two weeks, I didn't ever get to use these.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Heath

customer_reviews.title: Our household saving grace!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased these covers in most colors and they are all amazing. Some are a little thicker/less flexible than others (I find the red and green to be on the thinner more flexible side where the blue are a little harder/thicker), but these have been absolutely amazing. We have a male cat who scratches carpet just for fun... these have saved our rugs and don't bother him (aside from the being held still to apply them)! Definitely suggest these to anyone looking to stop damage to furniture/carpet/skin with a cat who won't listen! :)
customer_reviews.author: Nikki W.

customer_reviews.title: These claw covers work pretty well and come with plenty of glue applicators
customer_reviews.text: These claw covers work pretty well and come with plenty of glue applicators. The bright colors help to show when the cat has lost one. A couple tips would be trim the claws back as much as possible and then also trim the actual cover (the part you put over the nail) just a little so the nail fits better and it doesn't push up against the toe very much. I did one foot without trimming the cover and one with trimming the cover and my cat tried, and succeeded, in pulling off a couple covers on the untrimmed one.
customer_reviews.author: April A.

customer_reviews.title: Most Humane Way to Save Your Furniture!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best invention ever! I took me a long time to discover these as I'd dismissed colored nails on felines and dogs as strange before I knew they were the cutest and most humane way to save your furniture! Declawing practices do not typically involve removal of the first ligaments in the cats paws, however, it still presents itself troubling side effects that I'd never want to bring about to my 2 cats. They both have super cute candy red nails! If I ever get sick of the colors, Soft Claws comes in clear as well. Love this product! Love having it come to my door step!
customer_reviews.author: IOweAmazonMyFirstBorn

customer_reviews.title: Definitely help!
customer_reviews.text: We have been putting these on our cat since the day we got her as a kitten. I make sure to trim her claws a few days before putting on. We normally have to replace them every 2-3 weeks, but a nail could potentially fall off the same day we put them on depending on her nail shed cycle or if she gets the nails caught up with a toy. We still have some destruction to our couch from her random nails, but overall, we continue to use these as they are a great alternative to not having anything on her nails.
customer_reviews.author: digiproducer

customer_reviews.title: Furniture Saver
customer_reviews.text: I love these claw caps! They work perfectly on my cat. The first time I tried to place them on my cat it was difficult. However, the more I used them the better I got. They last for about 3-4 weeks. I originally purchased them because my cat loves to scratch our couch. These claw caps ensure that my furniture does not get destroyed.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel K

customer_reviews.title: It was a bit difficult to get the glue in the nail cap thing but once I got the hang of that it was pretty easy (my cat doesnt c
customer_reviews.text: Oh man these things are hilarious. It was a bit difficult to get the glue in the nail cap thing but once I got the hang of that it was pretty easy (my cat doesnt care about her paws being touched so I could see how this could be difficult with other cats). After putting them all on, my cat couldnt care less about them, and now she cant scratch up the couch! Plus now she looks like she has her nails done all the time, love it.
customer_reviews.author: Krysten

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work better than SoftPaws brand claw covers!
customer_reviews.text: These worked *really* well. I normally buy SoftPaws and have them put on by my local vet. This time, plans didn't go so well so I ended up with this product instead (Soft Claws for Cats - CLS [Cleat Lock System]) and had them put on by a different vet's office. I don't know whether it was the product or the technique but these have stayed on WAY longer than the soft paws ever did! For my specific use, I really only need them to stay on the cat for a week or two, but if you require more staying power than that, then I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: R. Dekema

customer_reviews.title: These are better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: These are better than nothing. They only stay on my cat about a week. Also since they dont all fall off at once, you are constantly having to check and reapply one or two at a time. I went almost two weeks without checking my cats claws and when I did, I saw that only 2 were still on. Another bad thing is I think my cat is eating them when they come off as I have only found a few on the floor when there should be more. Maybe they should include a higher quality of glue?
customer_reviews.author: techyoda

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome for use as a training tool as your cat's growing. You should still have a scratching post to encourage the cat where they are supposed to exercise their toes. These save on your furniture and carpet while your cat is still learning and fall off as your cat grows. It is easier to put on when their nails are clipped and you have the clear covers (you can see the amount of "glue" going in to the nail cap).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome alternative to De-Clawing!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these for my cat. I had my first two cats de-clawed which is nice in some aspects, but it is really cruel. This way, my kitty can still have his claws, but do no damage! I have a really chill cat, so he's always been fine with me putting these on him. Be careful if your cat has sensitive paws/claws though. How quickly they fall off really just depends on your cat's nail cycle, or how often they use a scratcher. But this has saved my own skin and my furniture! I have tried it on the back claws, but they only stayed on for about a day or so. Really great product though!
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: No declawing!
customer_reviews.text: Both of my cats are really chill and let me put these bad boys on. The small size is too small and the medium is sometimes too big. I had to go to Petco and see the sizes in real life. But, the good news is you can trim them down a bit to the size you need. They last a long time (6-8 weeks for my babies. Although their nails get really long) without falling off. PS My babies are indoor only.
customer_reviews.author: It'sMe

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to come off
customer_reviews.text: For one of my cats, these were fine, but for the other one, three of the soft claws we put on didn't want to come off, even after her nails were very obviously way too long. We had to try to cut them off and use superglue remover to get them off, which seemed to be very uncomfortable for the kitty. I might try again using ones that don't have the Cleat Lock System, because I'd rather replace them periodically than have to struggle to get them off when they're causing discomfort from the nail being too long.
customer_reviews.author: NDinOKC

customer_reviews.title: This works well and stays on for at least 4 days
customer_reviews.text: These helped keep the kitty from scratching her neck which had been rubbed raw by a flea collar she reacted badly to. Not tough to attach either.. takes one drop of this glue, which is pretty much super glue so don't get it on anything. Rinse your hands with good gone or degreaser or baby oil if it gets on your skin. Wear glasses when you apply it if possible.
customer_reviews.author: A & J

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered this product several times, and I'm thrilled with the results! My cat is an indoor cat, but the vet's office recommends that we don't put the Soft Claws on her back paws in case she were to ever get out,and needed to climb a tree or defend herself. These are meant to protect our furniture and our bodies from her front claws, and they work like a charm! I personally like the bright red look, and many who see her think I actually paint her nails. Very functional and attractive. I highly recommend these for indoor only cats.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Rinzler

customer_reviews.title: not for every cat.
customer_reviews.text: It does work but you have to check on these about weekly or else they just randomly start falling off. They pretty much are done after two weeks. Not to mention you have to make sure your cat isn't chewing them off like mine was. My cat was practically self-mutilating to get these off and messed up a nail or two. I didn't want him to damage his nails for the sake of my couch so I stopped using them after a month. I actually bought some years before and didn't recall why I didn't like them (they work!) but then when I watch my cat obsessively gnaw at his nails for 20 minutes straight I remember.
customer_reviews.author: Fiendship Fun

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: Size medium was purchased for kittens that are almost a year old. They were really easy to apply with 2 people. You just have to be careful to not get too much glue and it leak on your fingers....but enough for the soft claws to stay on. Following the first application on 2 cats (front paws only), only one claw came off by the next day. After 2 weeks about half are still on, but I consider that great because my cats use a scratching post and are very playful. I would recommend these if your cats are leaving scratch marks on things.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE THINGS!
customer_reviews.text: These things are the best! My cat us a terror and destroys EVERYTHING with his nails. With these on he can't ruin a thing, or scratch us. He is a pretty relaxed cat so getting these on him (with the help of my husband... definitely a 2 person job) it takes less than ten minutes and a few horrid cat noises. His stay on for 2 weeks or so and gradually fall off and we replace them. The red color was nice for the 4th of July. Added a little Cat pizzazz to our lives.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Wigner

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!
customer_reviews.text: I'm lucky to have a very mellow cat who just sat in my lap and let me apply these. It took a few minutes for him to adjust but then was fine. I love that he no longer wakes me up at 4am by attacking any exposed skin. I also think he looks great with his red claws and because the color is so bright, it's easy to tell if any fell off. And the furniture is finally safe. He's worn them for about a week so far and hasn't lost any yet. I will always keep these on my cat!
customer_reviews.author: LisaLovesShoes!

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Worked better than expected! A 2 man job. My female cat bit me in the process, the male could care less. But my cats got accustomed to them quickly - I thought my male cat would've bitten them off by now (4 days). If I would have known you could do this without taking the cats to a vet, I would have done so a few years ago. They've attempted to scratch my new slipcover but no snags! So far so good. Will update review in a few weeks if the situation changes.
customer_reviews.author: Camille

customer_reviews.title: These soft paws really did work on my cat! ...
customer_reviews.text: These soft paws really did work on my cat! It just was a “beach” getting them on him until I decided to put a tube sock over his head to calm him down. I’m sure not all cats are as feisty as mine. I think he has a complex because I put girly coloured nails on him - I just wanted to be able to see when he lost one. They lasted about one month.
customer_reviews.author: Attilla

customer_reviews.title: Definitely get these!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter bought these for her cat, he's a bigger cat but he has smaller paws. He was clawing the carpet and the couch and after they put these on.. he wasn't a fan at first but now he's not destroying the carpet or anything. Easy to put on too! It was cheaper to buy them on here instead of at Petco or Petsmart (they're $25-$30 for the same ones) and the Softpaws ones are about the same after shipping and handling. $16 and he can't destroy anything because he didn't understand what his scratching post was for.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Excell

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic alternative to declawing!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! Even though they're supposed to last for 6 weeks, they can actually last for much longer, depending on how your cat is. I have 4 cats all together and all of them had Soft Claws put on their front paws. One of my cats really dislikes them being on her claws and she tried to get them off, but they lasted 6 weeks just like they were supposed to for her. However, the rest of the cats don't mind them at all, and they've lasted a few months on their claws! They're definitely worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rose D.

customer_reviews.title: Never Again!!
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews and more on these. I had them placed on my cat by the vet. I'm sorry but I don't see where having these on makes a difference! She's still able to claw things! I thought these were suppose to prevent that?? I find them useless!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Great... at first.
customer_reviews.text: At first we thought these were the perfect solution. But be warned, When the claws start growing out, the claw covers do too. But they don't just "drop off". As the claw gets longer, the claw covers start to curl under the cats foot, (in the natural curved angle of the claw) They will be like un-retracatable claws. It interferes slightly with walking until it can get so long the claw finally breaks off. The cat was obviously NOT a fan and chewed on them a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Eric DeWeber

customer_reviews.title: Useful for cats with itchy skin
customer_reviews.text: My cat is a good sport about having these applied--I just have to distract him for a while afterwards so he doesn't pull them off. He unfortunately has had recurring issues food allergies that make him itch; these claw caps let him scratch without tearing holes in his skin and are much more tolerable for him than wearing an e-collar or similar device to keep him from damaging his face.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: These don't really stay on my cat. One nail inevitably comes off on the first day, every time. The last nail usually comes off within a week. And I know what you're thinking, but yes, I put them on correctly. Trimmed his nails first and everything. I also am not a huge fan of the glue system, it's messy and you have to be REALLY careful not to get the glue on the sheath of your cat's toes. I know this is all stuff to be expected, but it still kind of sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: so good. The cats still scratch
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. The cats still scratch, but the damage is pretty much eliminated. I still have their scratch pads around the house. Two cats, two colors of claws, so when one falls off I know whose needs replacing. One kitty has had them on since March 17- about 2 and a half months, and I have only had to put on 2 new ones. The other cat has had about 8 replaced in the same time period. I only use them on the front 8 claws. I bought my first two packages locally at a higher price.
customer_reviews.author: mom in vermont

customer_reviews.title: Purrrrrfect Claw Caps
customer_reviews.text: I used to use Whisker City claw caps and I thought they were good until I used these! These are so much softer and more flexible than the WC ones so it is much easier to get them on my cat. They seemed to stay on better than the old ones too, but I'm not sure if that is because the glue is a better quality or if because the softer caps fit better.
customer_reviews.author: QueenofGnomes

customer_reviews.title: Our chair is saved!
customer_reviews.text: I applied them a couple weeks ago, Within the first night we lost one tip. I think it was user error and our cat chewing at them. Now that they've been on for a while he's gotten used to them. They have fallen off most of his nails, so I'll need to reapply soon. But it's really helped deter the scratching. Our cat is about 10 pounds and polydactyl(extra toes) and it worked great with a size medium.
customer_reviews.author: marianne

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: These went on perfectly and so far have stayed on for 4 days without issue. The glue holds holds very quickly, which makes application so much easier. My cat is about 10lbs and a pretty thin frame and the medium fit his nails well. The caps are a somewhat pliable plastic. No issues with skin irritation or adhesion at all.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Zuniga

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my little guys nails, easy instructions, keep it in the fridge like recommended and the glue stays fresh. They fell off within a few weeks but I didn't put them on all of the way onto the nail since it was my first time and I had a little difficulty. Going for round two tonight though, he isn't bothered by them at all so it's pretty easy thankfully.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I got the small size for my 4 month old kitten. I had to cut off the opening a little to fit his nails a little better. He wasn’t happy about putting them on but as soon as I put him down he didn’t even notice. He hasn’t chewed at them or anything and they’ve stayed on no problem. I put them on his front and back. I will definitely keep buying these!!
customer_reviews.author: Shawna Sizemore

customer_reviews.title: saved my furniture for a couple of days at least
customer_reviews.text: My vet put these on super fast and they've lasted 2weeks to going on a month on one cat. The cats tried to remove them but were unable to. Definitely worth it
customer_reviews.author: jojo

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Once the cats got used to them ... They were great. It took 3 tries to get caps on all 8 claws. It worked best when I caught them sleeping & put a couple on at a time. The cats are used to them now & I only have to replace 1-2 per week. (I have 3 cats) No scratching the furniture & no getting scratched (accidentally) when they decide to sit on my face in the middle of the night. If you are a cat owner you know what I'm talking about 😀😁😜
customer_reviews.author: Penski

customer_reviews.title: Poor Kitty
customer_reviews.text: Good idea. But you get the glue anywhere but on nail you have a problem. And putting on nails is no ez task. And touch your cat with a little glue on your fingers and pull its fur off. And not to Mention the glue sticking to your fingers for days.
customer_reviews.author: Executive Detail Brock Sanders

customer_reviews.title: you have about 5 seconds to get the cap on the nail before the glue hardens and cal becomes useless. Same glue quality makes the glue dispenser difficult ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made, the glue is superquick dry, you have about 5 seconds to get the cap on the nail before the glue hardens and cal becomes useless. Same glue quality makes the glue dispenser difficult to use, but once you get a hang of it its quite easy and looks super cool. Good thing is they dont come off no matter how strong your cat.
customer_reviews.author: Ali A.

customer_reviews.title: With time/money this can work well, but... yeah
customer_reviews.text: They work, but I had a hard time avoiding them coming off 1-2 at a time. This is problematic since it's difficult to re-use the glue 1-by-1 - might work better to buy the glue separately? I also don't care much for finding discarded nail caps all over the house...
customer_reviews.author: Justin Leonard

customer_reviews.title: These are super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These are super easy to use.... as long as your cat won't fight you too hard. It took a little trial and error on my first try to get them right. You just put a little dab of the glue into the tip of the nail cap, and press it onto the cat's nail. Make sure you don't put too much glue though, because it will spill out when it goes over the nail and it will get all in her fur.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Haynie

customer_reviews.title: ALSO- I always treat my kitty with her favorite food or treats to distract her while thy are ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great- once you get kitty used to them. It's important to always replace one that they bite off- after they realize they will just keep getting replaced, they should stop pulling them off as badly. ALSO- I always treat my kitty with her favorite food or treats to distract her while thy are drying on hr paws so she does not pull them off.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail.M

customer_reviews.title: Safety, functionality
customer_reviews.text: The nails do not stay on, they fall off the next day. Great idea but needs an improvement. We need a solution, the surgery is horrible and abusive, I thought I’d give it a try. I hope you can improve these without harming the cat.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Streveler

customer_reviews.title: Saved my furniture
customer_reviews.text: If your cat trusts you you should be ok It comes with glue but you are better off using super glue my cat did try to bite them off that was annoying but he hasn't touched my couch - he is mainly will use his scratching post - second on time around he knew these were going on so not as easy - they fall off around 3 weeks or before that because of pulling them off
customer_reviews.author: Stacy617

customer_reviews.title: ... wish I didn’t keep trying these hoping for a better outcome. They are a pain to put them ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I didn’t keep trying these hoping for a better outcome. They are a pain to put them on, and they really don’t last. Except for one or two where the glue oozed a bit- those things are STUCK. I’m going back to hoping I remember to clip the claws regularly instead of these caps.
customer_reviews.author: MamaCoov3

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product.
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic. I recommend rolling your cat up in a blanket (or "purr-ito as they say) to put them on. I put the glue in all 5 caps first and then do one paw. I return a few hours later to do the other paw. The kitty still scratches but no damage is done. A great declawing alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Tara F.

customer_reviews.title: Claw covers - Recommend
customer_reviews.text: These are great if you choose to NOT declaw your cat. I couldn't do it, as he does go outside, and it just seemed too cruel to put him thruogh. We place them on his front claws only, and it has saved some of the furniture. I say SOME because he will eventually "claw" them off and we find them through out the house. Still an improvement on his previous behaviours. Friends have tried these, but do not like them. I recommend!! And we try the differrent colors with the seasons (my husband's idea!)
customer_reviews.author: LORRIE F

customer_reviews.title: Just watch that they don't grow into the cats pad
customer_reviews.text: Terrific product. My cat still tries to scratch with these on, but he can't do much damage. I used to just keep his claws clipped short and he would listen to me when I told him not to scratch, but he's gotten stubborn in his old age and has decided he can do what he pleases. These stay on WAY longer than I expected (some of them have stayed on for months) and one of them actually starting growing into my cats pad. Just check on them every week or so and trim them (with the cover still on) if they are getting close to your cats pad. As they fall off just replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Brion L Webster

customer_reviews.title: Sassy toes!!!
customer_reviews.text: Are little guy is a bit more sassy now, than before the red claw caps!!! They are our favorite color so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kerrie

customer_reviews.title: Love these caps!
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats who love to destroy anything and everything that they can. I decided to use these caps as an alternative to declawing. After using this product for years now, I recommend it to any cat owners that I know. These caps will save your furniture and your sanity! I have also used other brands, but I have found that this brand lasts the longest and fits my cats the best. These caps are double the price at other stores. Not only is this a great product, it is also a great price!
customer_reviews.author: doobie060

customer_reviews.title: These work!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my kitten who was clawing everything. They work! I wish they weren't so expensive but it's cheaper than a new couch! If you're looking for caps I would buy these. All of the other products on Amazon have terrible reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Someone

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly fit my 8-9 lb cat (Medium). A little ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly fit my 8-9 lb cat (Medium). A little bit of a pain to put on and to replace only a couple at a time when the nails shed... I think I'll run out of glue applicator tips prior to using all of the nails due to having to replace only a couple nails at a time. But they do help limit the damage to our carpet!
customer_reviews.author: Moire

customer_reviews.title: I love it, my cat took some getting used to it...
customer_reviews.text: I love it, my cat took some getting used to it, but eventually she came around to the idea. basically, trim cat nails, then apply super glue to cover and insert the trimmed nail, rinse and repeat for all 20 toes. Cat lost the first set inside of a week, but the next few sets have lasted over a month each
customer_reviews.author: galiosucks

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for my Cat
customer_reviews.text: With a couple of young grandchildren I was worried about my cat taking a swipe at one of them until he got used to them. These went on without a problem and didn't bother my cat a bit. They started coming off one at a time about a week after putting them on but the kids were long gone by then. After about a month there were still a couple of them on him but I was able to pull them off without upsetting the cat. I used them a couple more times after that with the same satisfactory results. Good idea.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Glue is toxic
customer_reviews.text: I got these on my long haired cat but most of them didn't stay on too long. Since the Soft Claws were solid red, I could not see if I got enough glue in it before applying. I didn't want to overfill them because then the glue would be pushed out and get in her fur. I didn't want her licking even the dried glue so I haven't tried again. It would be better if the glue was non toxic. They didn't seem to bother her too much and to keep her from clawing the furniture, I might try them again but only in clear.
customer_reviews.author: Barney's Mom

customer_reviews.title: They work but they do not stay on very well ...
customer_reviews.text: They work but they do not stay on very well. As you might guess GETTING them on the cat is a bit of trouble....well, more trouble than they are worth for the amount of time they stay on. Maybe with stronger glue?
customer_reviews.author: SODA

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME product
customer_reviews.text: I wish I purchased this product years ago! This is saving what is left to my carpets and furniture! It was difficult to put the caps on the cats because they resisted a lot BUT now that they are on, it is wonderful and the do not seem to know the difference. It will be interesting to see how it goes when I have to put more on once they shed their nails but I think it is worth the short battle.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: While these are much easier to put on than I ...
customer_reviews.text: While these are much easier to put on than I feared, I have to replace at least one daily. I have gone through all the glue extender tips and had to order extra just to keep up with the daily replacement. I'm really hoping that they are only falling off due to the natural shedding of the nails or because I didn't originally trim their nails enough. Otherwise this will be very expensive upkeep. I can't see having to do this every single day.
customer_reviews.author: SnowHibiscus

customer_reviews.title: So far so good with these
customer_reviews.text: So far so good with these. My cat stayed still while we put them on and did not freak out about them being on. You do have to replace them often as they fall off. Unfortunately my cat has long hair and it is hard to make sure it is all out of the way when you are trying to get these glued on quickly so I noticed some tuffs of hair stuck to these.
customer_reviews.author: flora

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: my cat doesn't mind these at all. and they are so cute! she no longer scratches the furniture. these are surprisingly easy to apply. no need to pay the vet to do it - i did it myself with two small kids underfoot :) i love the red color. my kitty looks like she just had her nails done. she's had them on for about 10 days i think and hasn't tried to chew them off. she still uses her scratching posts with them on for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: adamswifeamanda

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting, excellent product!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a college student and my kitty likes to tear my papers up. The vet put her previous set on (white in pic) and as they fell off I put the red ones on. Three weeks and still going (the previous ones have been on since September and it’s now December...I just trim as the nail grows). If you put sufficient glue and prevent kitty from chewing them for 30 min. they work extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: The idea is nice, but once the claw grows out
customer_reviews.text: The idea is nice, but once the claw grows out, the cat can get the edge stuck in something. I found a claw cap stuck in my door wedge (the part where the deadbolt is). I am assuming my cat was stretching and it got caught. I won’t use them again, because I am worried the cat could hurt himself or rip a claw out.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Saving my cat from getting declawed, THANK YOU!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to apply and so far they're lasting. Definitely an alternative to declawing. Get the colored ones in case they fall off so you can find them in the carpet or whatever.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Whitman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and fits great
customer_reviews.text: We use Soft Claws on our rag doll cat. He is rather floppy so that makes putting these on much easier. They fit nicely and last a while. He tends to chew on them to try to get them off, but we can usually go 4-6 weeks before we need to reapply. I definitely recommend this product if you have a corporative cat. My other cats are declawed, but I couldn't imagine the blood bath that would happen if I had to put Soft Claws on them.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: These claw cleats are a fantastic invention. It will take your cat a little while to get used to having them on their claws, but they'll eventually get over it. Ours tried to chew at them for a little bit, but soon calmed down. It definitely helps protect your furniture as long as you make sure to replace them as they shed off.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mc

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I love these soft claws...I thought that the cats would not be able to retract their claws with these, but I was wrong. They act like nothing is there. So much better and more humane than declawing. (which I have done to previous cats I owned) Will never de-claw another cat again. These are furniture savers! Very easy to apply. If you have a cat who doesnt like their paws touched, just ask your vet to do it for a minimal charge. Very easy and stylist too!
customer_reviews.author: L. Link

customer_reviews.title: definitely worth the effort for cat lovers
customer_reviews.text: My cat hated these, but my cat is kind of a jerk. I am giving the stars because of the safety of materials, ease of application, the great concept (declawing just makes me sad), and the hysterically funny colors. A laid back kitty should give you absolutely no problems with the application of these. If your furry pal is neurotic however watch out.
customer_reviews.author: carrie

customer_reviews.title: My cat is some sort of claw cover removing wizard ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat is some sort of claw cover removing wizard as I can never keep any claw cover on him long. I will say that the glue that comes with this brand is easier to squeeze into the small caps than another brand I bought from Petco.
customer_reviews.author: F. Guimarin

customer_reviews.title: These are great!! My husband was almost to the point ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great!! My husband was almost to the point of having our cat declawed. We used these for about 4months and it stopped Trigger's scratching at our bedroom door. We have since taken them off and he no longer scratches. It takes a bit to get used to applying them. A little glue goes a long way, this is similar to super glue. Also, having someone to help hold the cat is definitely recommended. He wanted to chew them off for the first few minutes then became used to them quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Delta York

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: They were pretty easy to put on if your cat doesn't squirm much. Squeeze a little glue in, squish them to open up a bit more and slide right on to your cats clipped nails. It's been two days and my cat hasn't chewed them off yet, which is a good sign!
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: Held on and worked better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased for my 6 year old cat. It was her first time wearing these and I honestly didn't expect it to work. But they must be someone comfortable because after an evening of pouting she is acting perfectly normal. Pleased with them and will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Darkskittlez23

customer_reviews.title: These nail caps work well.
customer_reviews.text: These nail caps work well. My cat does not seem to mind them once they are on. The trouble is putting them on. You need to clip the cat's nails prior to placing. It is best to start early, as it will be more traumatizing for an older cat. It also, works better to make it a two person job. One person holding the cat and calming it, while the other applies the nail caps. It is a lot better than declawing. I would never do that to an animal.
customer_reviews.author: L. Stark

customer_reviews.title: Problem Solver!
customer_reviews.text: I love these. My kitten tolerates them. He tried biting them off at first but then got used to them. It's definitely a two person job to put these on though. They last a long time. :)
customer_reviews.author: Audree AD

customer_reviews.title: No real benefit for all the effort
customer_reviews.text: Unimpressed. Cat's nails have to be at just the right length to properly affix these ... which means you need to constantly be monitoring when to apply and re-apply. Cat still scratched things so if even one nail cover was off the benefit is lost. A lot of trouble for minimal good.Won't be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: ehm1217

customer_reviews.title: My cat walked off the first time acting like she didn't even notice them
customer_reviews.text: My cat wears these all the time. They don't have them in the pet store where I live, so it helps that they arrive in about two days. It does take a little practice to get them on right, right amount of glue, etc. My cat walked off the first time acting like she didn't even notice them. My new furniture is grateful.
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: they lasted a while and held up great. Next
customer_reviews.text: These are definitely not for the lazy, you have to check them daily to make sure one hasn't come off, as one little nail uncovered can do lots of damage! First, I bought the pink nails, they lasted a while and held up great. Next, I bought the red ones. This time, the minute I get one on him, he goes and bites the tip off, causing a rough edge. I also worry that he may choke on the piece he is biting off. I don't know why the pink ones were more durable than the red, but it's a big difference, crazy as it sounds. Hope this helps, I'll be purchasing more pink nail covers asap.
customer_reviews.author: Stylist2Starz

customer_reviews.title: No issues with this product works great. I ordered both large and medium packs and ...
customer_reviews.text: No issues with this product works great. I ordered both large and medium packs and realized the medium is a bit too small for my cat.With that said, I will continue to restock the large sized caps for my large breed cats.
customer_reviews.author: lisa hartwig

customer_reviews.title: I'd recommend warming up your kitteh by playing with their paws ...
customer_reviews.text: I'd recommend warming up your kitteh by playing with their paws while you wait for this to arrive in the mail. And it's definitely a two-person job, but overall it's surprisingly easy to do. We had them on in less than 20 minutes once we figured out our strategy. They stayed on for several weeks and we've had to reapply a couple here and there, but overall I think this is a great buy. Plus, my cat looks extra stylish now.
customer_reviews.author: LindseyC

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: These work great on my 20lb cat to keep him from ruining the furniture. If I hold him for 5 minutes or so after applying he usually can't get them off. He is very docile and doesn't resist me clipping his claws or applying. I like having extras when one does come off. I will order again in a new color!! If you can't clip your cats claws you may have a hard time with these or need 2 people to apply.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa B.

customer_reviews.title: These are great when they stay on
customer_reviews.text: These are great when they stay on. We've been putting these on our cat for months and they still fall off. I don't want to declaw him because he's a grown up cat and I've heard it's very painful for them...but, always having to put these nails on is a bit of a pain. I am going to try getting the special fingernail cutters for cats and see if that helps with keeping the darn things on. When they are on he doesn't scratch anything...and that's wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: P. Baumeister

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't a good item for my cat
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't a good item for my cat. They did stay on well if you added enough glue (I had to go buy more locally). But our cat didn't like them and when they came off his nails were in bad shape.
customer_reviews.author: Shaken Ink

customer_reviews.title: It is amazing how well they work and stay on
customer_reviews.text: Where have these been all my life. It is amazing how well they work and stay on. We have had them on my cat for a week and she is still doing great with them. We recently purchased new couches and we haven't had to worry about them or her. Will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: iheartamazon

customer_reviews.title: I must be doing something wrong, doesn't last more than a couple weeks
customer_reviews.text: Only lasted about 2 weeks the first time around and even less the second attempt. Going to keep at it until I'm out of claws, but I feel like I must be doing something incorrectly during the application process. It seems straight forward - Put glue in cap -> attach to nail, but hey, who knows.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Stylish on your cats, and comforting for your skin and furniture
customer_reviews.text: Some of these come a little squished and small, so it's harder to open and get the nails on. But otherwise these are great for keeping your cats from doing their own redecorating around the home, and lets your skin stay non shredded.
customer_reviews.author: Oki_BriTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: I like the variety of colors available
customer_reviews.text: Soft claws works well. I like the variety of colors available. They are a bit tighter to get on then soft paws brand but it is no big deal. Our cat is cooperative which helps. The most important thing to remember is trimming your cats nails before applying. Since the soft claw sometimes last a couple months, the nail can grow into the pads of their paw.
customer_reviews.author: hummer8

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these..I have been having issues with my cats scratching the furniture..We have these on all 4 cats and they work great. When you first put them on they do not last as long because some of the cats nails may already be in the processes of shedding. Now that we are on the 2nd round they are lasting about 3 weeks per nail!!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: These have been a lifesaver for my furniture, carpeting ...
customer_reviews.text: These have been a lifesaver for my furniture, carpeting and skin. It can be tricky to get them onto the wiggly kittens and not end up with glue all over myself, but once the covers are on, no more scratching things up. To top it off, they look so cute. Everyone asks if we gave them a manicure!
customer_reviews.author: Zulikha

customer_reviews.title: Soft Claws solved the Problem
customer_reviews.text: One of our kitties was scratching his ears... we checked for mites etc, but found none. The soft claws allowed the scratched area to heal, and he has refrained from scratching ever since. Prior to using Soft Claws we had tried ointments, a cone collar and all sorts of things...this was the best solution by far.
customer_reviews.author: California Connie

product_meta.title: Soft Claws Red Cat Nail Caps
product_meta.description: Size:MediumFeline soft claws nail caps take-home kit helps customers protect their homes against destructive scratching by applying soft claws nail caps to their pets' nails. A great add-on to your routine professional nail care. This is simple, non-surgical alternative to declawing. Easy-to-apply caps last 4-6 weeks and will not interfere with pet's normal behavior. Non-toxic nail caps are safe if swallowed. Feline take-home kit includes 40 nail caps, adhesive, 6 applicator tips and instructions. Steps for application - Trim the tips of cat's nails. Fill nail caps 1/3 full with adhesive. Extend nails by gently pressing on top with the index finger on the bottom of the paw. Observe cat for five minutes before release. Approximately 9-13 pounds. Most adult average size cats wear medium. Measures 6-4/5-inch length by 5-inch width by 1-1/2-inch height. Available in medium size with red color.
feature_bullets: Protect homes against destructive scratching by applying Soft Claws Nail Caps to kittens nails
This is simple, non-surgical alternative to declawing
Easy-to-apply caps last 4-6 weeks and will not interfere with pet's normal behavior
Feline take-home kit includes 40 nail caps, adhesive, 6 applicator tips and instructions
Measures 6-4/5-inch length by 5-inch width by 1-1/2-inch height, available in medium size with red color

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
